article: The way often used to acquire information is through reading. In college you're expected to do much more _ than in high school. When you read, read _ . Read to answer questions you have asked yourself _ questions the author has asked. _ be alert to or italicized print. This material needs to receive special emphasis. Also, when you read, be _ to read everything, including tables, graphs and illustrations . Often tables, graphs and illustrations can _ an idea more powerfully than written text. _ the main idea in reading is central to effective studying. You must learn what the author's central idea is, and understand it in your own way. Every _ contains a main idea. Make it a _ to find the main idea in each paragraph you read. There is usually one important _ associated with every main idea. The more important details you can identify, the _ it will be to _ for examinations because you have made a link between an idea and information that _ it. The more links you can make between details and ideas, as well as ideas themselves, the more powerful will be the efforts of your _ . Generally, reading _ to yourself does not help you study more effectively. _ you move your lips while you read, you're not reading efficiently. If you read aloud or move your lips while you're reading, you are reading slowly, so _ moving your lips. Try putting a finger over your lips. Your finger will _ you not to move your lips. Make an effort to read faster.
